Join the Formula Student Spain (Official Site) family!

Date: from August 1st to 7th 2024
Site: Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya (Montmeló)

Formula Student…
data.text:
𝗙𝗢𝗥𝗠𝗨𝗟𝗔 𝗦𝗧𝗨𝗗𝗘𝗡𝗧 & 𝗠𝗢𝗧𝗢 𝗦𝗧𝗨𝗗𝗘𝗡𝗧 - 𝗡𝗧𝗡 𝗘𝘂𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗲 𝗮𝗹𝗼𝗻𝗴𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲 𝗦𝗽𝗮𝗻𝗶𝘀𝗵 𝗲𝗻𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀! 🏁 ISC Racing Team (ICAI) FSUPV Team (Universidad Politécnica de Valencia) UPM MotoStudent Electric (Universidad Politécnica de Madrid) UVigo Motorsport (Universidad de Vigo) These 4 engineering student teams have one thing in common: they compete in the Formula Student / Moto Student competitions! 🏎️ 🏍️ 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁'𝘀 𝗶𝘁 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁? 🤔 International competitions that bring together students from all over the world. 𝗧𝗵𝗲𝗶𝗿 𝗺𝗶𝘀𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻? 🎯 To design, develop and pilot a racing car or motorcycle on various European circuits. These competitions represent much more than a simple educational project; they offer future engineers real professional experience! That's why we're proud to sponsor these teams and support them by supplying the bearings they need to build their prototypes. In addition, dedicated bearing training sessions are organised especially for them, to perfect their knowledge and help them make the most of our products. We wish them all the best of luck! 💪 Stay tuned to follow their news and future exploits 🚀 #ntneurope #formulastudent #motostudent #engineers

Elevating Excellence KFurnitures Proudly Gifts Tool Trolley for Formula Student UK '23 In the world of engineering and innovation, the journey towards excellence is paved with dedication, collaboration, and the right tools. The Formula Student UK '23 competition stands as a testament to the spirit of young engineers pushing the boundaries of technology and performance. Among the driving forces behind this journey is KFurnitures, a company that believes in investing in the potential of the future. With immense pride and a commitment to nurturing talent, KFurnitures has generously gifted a Tool Trolley for the Formula Student UK '23 team. This contribution not only symbolizes support but also plays a pivotal role in turbocharging the team's spirit and capabilities. A Glimpse into Formula Student UK: Formula Student UK is not just a competition; it's an exhilarating experience that unites student teams from around the globe. Organized by the Institution of Mechanical Engineers, the event challenges these teams to design, build, and race a single-seat racing car. Beyond the racetrack, the competition evaluates the participants' engineering prowess, innovation, and business acumen through various static and dynamic events. Formula Student UK encourages students to apply classroom knowledge to real-world scenarios, fostering a generation of engineers prepared to tackle complex challenges. Empowering the Engineers of Tomorrow: KFurnitures, a company renowned for its commitment to quality and innovation, recognized the incredible potential of the Formula Student UK '23 team. The decision to gift a Tool Trolley was not just an act of sponsorship but a reflection of KFurnitures' dedication to supporting the educational journey of young engineers. By providing the Tool Trolley, KFurnitures aimed to streamline their efforts, enhance their efficiency, and contribute to their overall success. A Journey Towards Excellence: The Formula Student UK '23 competition is a journey, and like any journey, it's marked by challenges, triumphs, and personal growth. KFurnitures' contribution isn't just about the Tool Trolley; it's about the values it represents. It's a testament to the belief that investing in education, innovation, and collaboration can lead to remarkable outcomes. As the Formula Student UK '23 team takes to the track, their Tool Trolley will be right by their side, a symbol of the industry's unwavering support. With every turn of the wrench, every adjustment made, and every problem solved, the impact of KFurnitures' gift will resonate. It's a reminder that excellence isn't achieved overnight but through dedication, hard work, and the right tools. https://lnkd.in/dMd4N2z3 https://lnkd.in/dWtc4_V6 https://lnkd.in/d8B6JkrD #kfurnitures #steelmanufacturer #formula #f1 #Team #electrical #FSUK23 #fsuk #FormulaStudent #competition #engineering #Pakistan

I think it's fair to say that the UK is the de facto lead in motorsport engineering and we need to support that position so that we have a sustainable future for motorsport. There are two streams in engineering - 1. Academic - students wanting to do design, development and research, 2. Vocational/Practical - the 'Hands On' side, the mechanics and engineers who set the cars up, prepare the cars, rebuild them after accidents - the team members you see outside the garages doing the pitstops in F1. There is a serious shortage of suitable engineers, but particularly on the practical side. We have been advised that in July 2025 funding for the two mainstream 'motorsport' vocational qualifications is being withdrawn. We have heard that this is due to them not being able to demonstrate sufficient take up of careers in the motorsport sector. The reason for that is that they are not delivering the correct skills. SCU Motorsport undertook 10 months of research in 2019, supported by Ufi VocTech Trust, talking to race team managers and mechanics in WEC, ELMS, British GT, F4 and many other series to validate our approach. We also spoke to race car manufacturers and the supply chain and the unanimous feedback is that they would not take on students that had just completed either of the two mainstream qualifications. Why wasn't any analysis undertaken before making a decision to withdraw funding? Surely it would make more sense to understand the problem and address it - that is what SCU Motorsport have done and we constantly get feedback on our programme "that is what is needed". We are writing a qualification based on the feedback from the motorsport sector. We are in discussions with an awarding body for them to become our accreditation body. This is a sector that delivers £10 Billion to the UK Economy - struggling to get engineers with the right experience and skills, students who want to enter the motorsport sector and the funding to support this is being withdrawn. We will continue to develop our qualification based on the overseas interest we have. #fia #motorsporteducation Photo credit to GOV UK.

Formula Student Acceleration WORLD RECORD!! 🚀 The DUT23 broke the world record for the fastest acceleration time at a Formula Student competition with a time of 2.999 seconds at Formula Student East. This was completed with a full competition spec and scrutineered car. We would like to thank once again our partners and supporters, without whom this record would never have been achieved! 💙 At the acceleration event, the car covers a distance of 75 meters from standstill, with a power limit of 80 kW. When crossing the finish line, the DUT23 was doing 122.45 km/h. With our time of 2.999 seconds, we are the first team in Formula Student history to break the 3 second barrier at a FS competition! 🏎️ For more information, please watch 'Formula Student East 2023 TV - Day 5' on YouTube (https://lnkd.in/eU2VNT9N). We would like to extend our appreciation towards the organization of Formula Student East, for letting us use their footage for this video. 🤝 - #formulastudent #fseast #fseast2023 #race #car #racecar #engineer #innovation #design #technology #development #team #f1 #formula1 #explore #sport #motorsport #electric #competition #drive #university #delft #tudelft #dut23

🏁 Unbelievably gassed to announce our collaboration with Mercedes F1 🏁 Mercedes-AMG PETRONAS Formula One Team (MGP) is going to be powering 146 scholarships over two years with us to drive social mobility in motorsport, F1 and STEM. Our collaboration is amongst the largest commitment to social mobility scholarships in the UK - EVER. Talk about shaking up the UK. As well as funding the futures of talented Zero Gravity members, MGP launched an initiative called Accelerate 25, which aims to have at least 25% of their new starters come from under-represented groups by 2025. They aren’t just talking about changing things up - they’re actually doing it. Focusing in on students studying STEM, the Mercedes-Benz Grand Prix X Zero Gravity scholarship will be supporting 146 scholarships for talented students from low-opportunity backgrounds across the UK. The future is supercharged 🏎️ https://lnkd.in/eNSgxgxN #mercedesf1 #scholarships

DPR Motorsport - Shortlisted finalist in the Reigate & Banstead Business Awards 2023 DPR Motorsport has made the final shortlist for two categories in this demanding local competition. It is an outstanding achievement to be selected as a finalist for one category. All at DPR Motorsport are extremely proud, that in our case, we have been selected for two categories – The Business Support Grant Award and the Sustainable Business of the Year. The Reigate & Banstead Awards celebrate the very best organisations and individuals from the local area with ten award categories to highlight success across a range of business criteria. This is now the third year for these awards and with an increasing number of entries, competition is at an all-time high. David Rowe, Engineering Director, commented: When we moved our business to Redhill some six years ago, whilst some benefits were recognisable up-front, during our time on the Holmethorpe Industrial Estate we have come to fully appreciate the benefits from a great location, a local business eco-system second to none and a pool of local youngsters keen to progress into engineering through the apprenticeship route. The original Business Grant Award enabled us to invest in a range of tools and equipment to kick-start their progress. Graduates from our tailored engineering apprenticeship pathway will have gained both the practical and academic skills required at the highest levels of UK Motorsport. We take pride that our first apprentice, who joined McLaren some years ago, is now a key member of their Formula One race team supporting the Lando Norris car. Engineering excellence is at the front and centre of everything we do. It was no contradiction to adopt sustainability as core to our workplace approach. On our initial move to Redhill, we up-cycled rather than demolished what was a run-down 1950’s workshop. The renovation focused on taking full advantage of energy saving measures such as adding modern levels of insulation to the workshop together with investing in solar PV to help transition away from fossil fuels for heat and light. Reaching two of the final shortlists for the 2023 awards is an unexpected and therefore an all-the-more appreciated recognition of our work to grow the business. Key to this growth has been developing our young staff and improving the efficiency of our operational processes. Being able to gain numerous podium and championship wins in Caterham Motorsport events at the top UK and European motorsport race circuits has no doubt been a strong motivator to all concerned! #caterhammotorsport #RBBA23 #statementofexcellence

🌟 "Motivation is fleeting - find something you enjoy" - Dan Bigham 🌟 I've been reflecting on the journey of Dan Bigham, an engineer and Olympic cyclist, whose story epitomises the blend of passion and profession. Training for the upcoming Paris Olympics, Bigham cycled through the picturesque peaks of Andorra. It's not the scenery that gives him his unique perspective, but the choice he made years ago to balance both his career as an engineer and his passion as a cyclist. Bigham's journey is one of perseverance and innovation. From working with the Ineos Grenadiers team to founding WattShop, his path showcases an extraordinary synergy between engineering and elite sports. His love for simulations and modelling, rooted in his university days, played a key role in breaking the world hour record in cycling in 2022 - an impressive feat of riding 55.548km in 60 minutes. As he says, "There is a causable, tangible link between the things you learn at school and breaking world records." In a world constantly evolving with AI advancements, Bigham's insights into the future of sports engineering are incredibly inspiring. AI's role in predicting race outcomes and sports nutrition is redefining possibilities. His advice to younger engineers resonates deeply: "Motivation is fleeting - find something you enjoy." It's about perseverance, creativity, and finding joy in the journey, even when doors seem closed. 🚴♂️⚙️ #Olympic #DanBigham #EngineeringExcellence

Formula Student Acceleration WORLD RECORD! 🚀 Traveling 75 meters from standstill; acceleration is one of the four dynamic events on Formula Student competitions. This season, we took first place at the acceleration event during @formulastudenteast, with a time of 2.999 seconds! Not only did we set the fastest acceleration time on the competition, but we set the fastest time ever in Formula Student history, a world record! 🍾 With our time of 2.999 sec, we are the first team to break the 3 second barrier at a Formula Student competition. When crossing the finish line, the DUT23 was doing 122.45 km/h. This could not have been possible without the incredible hard work of all team members and the support of our dear partners. 💙 For more information, please watch 'Formula Student East 2023 TV - Day 5' on YouTube (https://lnkd.in/eU2VNT9N). - #formulastudent #fseast #fseast2023 #race #car #racecar #engineer #innovation #design #technology #development #team #f1 #formula1 #explore #sport #motorsport #electric #competition #drive #university #delft #tudelft #dut23

I want to be a race car driver! No, not really, but I'm sharing a great article from SAE International (Society of Automobile Engineers) about one of my favorite clients, Kevin Boehm Racing. In addition to being a class-act organization made up of outstanding individuals, Kevin's story is one that every kid who is struggling to figure out what they want to be, should hear. It's a story about how passion, hard work and a random conversation with a guy at a racetrack can change everything and pave the way to becoming a championship winning race car driver that just happens to also be an exceptionally talented engineer and an all around great guy. From Engineer to Champion: Kevin didn't start his career behind the wheel. He's an incredibly talented engineer who leverages his expertise to optimize every aspect of his racing performance. Dedication Defines Him: Kevin's journey wasn't paved with overnight success. It's a story of relentless effort, countless hours honing his skills, and an unwavering commitment to his dream. Inspiration for All: Kevin's story transcends the racing world. It's a powerful message for anyone, regardless of their aspirations. It reminds us that passion, perseverance, and a growth mindset can unlock incredible potential. What drives your passion? What seemingly impossible dream are you chasing? Share your story in the comments below! #inspiration #dedication #hardwork #engineering #racing #nevergiveup #dreamscometrue #kevinboehmracing P.S. Connect with Kevin and Boehm Racing to learn more about their incredible journey! https://lnkd.in/gWDB6f36
